content.description: Start with arms stretched around opposite sides of the roof each near the lip, heel up on the right side. Do best not to dab on the "cheater blocks" at the bottom for full value. Bump each hand to get secure holds and then swing feet up into the perfectly sized horizontal crack for a bat hang. Get your hand sup to your feet and then muscle around for a slopey topout.
content.location:
Lat: 40.574694 Long: -77.846285

 Here are the coordinates, its a bit right on the ridge from the marked parking location. You'll recognize it when you see it.

content.description: Start on the obvious sloper on the arete left of civil disobedience.Workup through sidepulls for a slopey insecure topout.
Start low on nubby holds with feet in the big hueco. Slap up to get good hands and maybe a heel up as well. Climb up and top out. Not to tricky.

This area of Hunter's is not well-explored or -documented. It is the northern extension of Rocky Ridge that lies on your left when you bear right to head towards the main Hunter's areas. There are no trails, but unless it's the dead of summer the underbrush isn't too bad. Most of the rock here is dirty and in need of cleaning. The rock is less densely spaced than at the main Hunter's area, and there are sections of stratified sandstone that are too loose to climb on. However, if you're willing to do a little exploring and some cleaning there are quality boulder problems to be had along the ridge.
